00053 static const std::string VERSION( "4.0.12" );

00071 typedef unsigned long RtAudioFormat;
00072 static const RtAudioFormat RTAUDIO_SINT8 = 0x1;    // 8-bit signed integer.
00073 static const RtAudioFormat RTAUDIO_SINT16 = 0x2;   // 16-bit signed integer.
00074 static const RtAudioFormat RTAUDIO_SINT24 = 0x4;   // 24-bit signed integer.
00075 static const RtAudioFormat RTAUDIO_SINT32 = 0x8;   // 32-bit signed integer.
00076 static const RtAudioFormat RTAUDIO_FLOAT32 = 0x10; // Normalized between plus/minus 1.0.
00077 static const RtAudioFormat RTAUDIO_FLOAT64 = 0x20; // Normalized between plus/minus 1.0.
00078 
00121 typedef unsigned int RtAudioStreamFlags;
00122 static const RtAudioStreamFlags RTAUDIO_NONINTERLEAVED = 0x1;    // Use non-interleaved buffers (default = interleaved).
00123 static const RtAudioStreamFlags RTAUDIO_MINIMIZE_LATENCY = 0x2;  // Attempt to set stream parameters for lowest possible latency.
00124 static const RtAudioStreamFlags RTAUDIO_HOG_DEVICE = 0x4;        // Attempt grab device and prevent use by others.
00125 static const RtAudioStreamFlags RTAUDIO_SCHEDULE_REALTIME = 0x8; // Try to select realtime scheduling for callback thread.
00126 static const RtAudioStreamFlags RTAUDIO_ALSA_USE_DEFAULT = 0x10; // Use the "default" PCM device (ALSA only).
00127 
00139 typedef unsigned int RtAudioStreamStatus;
00140 static const RtAudioStreamStatus RTAUDIO_INPUT_OVERFLOW = 0x1;    // Input data was discarded because of an overflow condition at the driver.
00141 static const RtAudioStreamStatus RTAUDIO_OUTPUT_UNDERFLOW = 0x2;  // The output buffer ran low, likely causing a gap in the output sound.
00142 
00144 
00182 typedef int (*RtAudioCallback)( void *outputBuffer, void *inputBuffer,
00183                                 unsigned int nFrames,
00184                                 double streamTime,
00185                                 RtAudioStreamStatus status,
00186                                 void *userData );
00187 
00189 
00193 typedef void (*RtAudioErrorCallback)( RtError::Type type, const std::string &errorText );
00194 
00195 // **************************************************************** //
00196 //
00197 // RtAudio class declaration.
00198 //
00199 // RtAudio is a "controller" used to select an available audio i/o
00200 // interface.  It presents a common API for the user to call but all
00201 // functionality is implemented by the class RtApi and its
00202 // subclasses.  RtAudio creates an instance of an RtApi subclass
00203 // based on the user's API choice.  If no choice is made, RtAudio
00204 // attempts to make a "logical" API selection.
00205 //
00206 // **************************************************************** //
00207 
00208 class RtApi;
00209 
00210 class RtAudio
00211 {
00212  public:
00213 
00215   enum Api {
00216     UNSPECIFIED,    
00217     LINUX_ALSA,     
00218     LINUX_PULSE,    
00219     LINUX_OSS,      
00220     UNIX_JACK,      
00221     MACOSX_CORE,    
00222     WINDOWS_ASIO,   
00223     WINDOWS_DS,     
00224     RTAUDIO_DUMMY   
00225   };
00226 
00228   struct DeviceInfo {
00229     bool probed;                  
00230     std::string name;             
00231     unsigned int outputChannels;  
00232     unsigned int inputChannels;   
00233     unsigned int duplexChannels;  
00234     bool isDefaultOutput;         
00235     bool isDefaultInput;          
00236     std::vector<unsigned int> sampleRates; 
00237     RtAudioFormat nativeFormats;  
00239     // Default constructor.
00240     DeviceInfo()
00241       :probed(false), outputChannels(0), inputChannels(0), duplexChannels(0),
00242        isDefaultOutput(false), isDefaultInput(false), nativeFormats(0) {}
00243   };
00244 
00246   struct StreamParameters {
00247     unsigned int deviceId;     
00248     unsigned int nChannels;    
00249     unsigned int firstChannel; 
00251     // Default constructor.
00252     StreamParameters()
00253       : deviceId(0), nChannels(0), firstChannel(0) {}
00254   };

00320     StreamOptions()
00321     : flags(0), numberOfBuffers(0), priority(0) {}

00517 // Operating system dependent thread functionality.
00518 #if defined(__WINDOWS_DS__) || defined(__WINDOWS_ASIO__)
00519   #include <windows.h>
00520   #include <process.h>
00521 
00522   typedef unsigned long ThreadHandle;
00523   typedef CRITICAL_SECTION StreamMutex;
00524 
00525 #elif defined(__LINUX_ALSA__) || defined(__LINUX_PULSE__) || defined(__UNIX_JACK__) || defined(__LINUX_OSS__) || defined(__MACOSX_CORE__)
00526   // Using pthread library for various flavors of unix.
00527   #include <pthread.h>
00528 
00529   typedef pthread_t ThreadHandle;
00530   typedef pthread_mutex_t StreamMutex;
00531 
00532 #else // Setup for "dummy" behavior
00533 
00534   #define __RTAUDIO_DUMMY__
00535   typedef int ThreadHandle;
00536   typedef int StreamMutex;
00537 
00538 #endif

00540 // This global structure type is used to pass callback information
00541 // between the private RtAudio stream structure and global callback
00542 // handling functions.
00543 struct CallbackInfo {
00544   void *object;    // Used as a "this" pointer.
00545   ThreadHandle thread;
00546   void *callback;
00547   void *userData;
00548   void *errorCallback;
00549   void *apiInfo;   // void pointer for API specific callback information
00550   bool isRunning;
00551   bool doRealtime;
00552   int priority;
00553 
00554   // Default constructor.
00555   CallbackInfo()
00556   :object(0), callback(0), userData(0), errorCallback(0), apiInfo(0), isRunning(false), doRealtime(false) {}
00557 };
00558 
00559 // **************************************************************** //
00560 //
00561 // RtApi class declaration.
00562 //
00563 // Subclasses of RtApi contain all API- and OS-specific code necessary
00564 // to fully implement the RtAudio API.
00565 //
00566 // Note that RtApi is an abstract base class and cannot be
00567 // explicitly instantiated.  The class RtAudio will create an
00568 // instance of an RtApi subclass (RtApiOss, RtApiAlsa,
00569 // RtApiJack, RtApiCore, RtApiDs, or RtApiAsio).
00570 //
00571 // **************************************************************** //
00572 
00573 #pragma pack(push, 1)
00574 class S24 {
00575 
00576  protected:
00577   unsigned char c3[3];
00578 
00579  public:
00580   S24() {}
00581 
00582   S24& operator = ( const int& i ) {
00583     c3[0] = (i & 0x000000ff);
00584     c3[1] = (i & 0x0000ff00) >> 8;
00585     c3[2] = (i & 0x00ff0000) >> 16;
00586     return *this;
00587   }
00588 
00589   S24( const S24& v ) { *this = v; }
00590   S24( const double& d ) { *this = (int) d; }
00591   S24( const float& f ) { *this = (int) f; }
00592   S24( const signed short& s ) { *this = (int) s; }
00593   S24( const char& c ) { *this = (int) c; }
00594 
00595   int asInt() {
00596     int i = c3[0] | (c3[1] << 8) | (c3[2] << 16);
00597     if (i & 0x800000) i |= ~0xffffff;
00598     return i;
00599   }
00600 };
00601 #pragma pack(pop)

00609 class RtApi
00610 {
00611 public:
00612 
00613   RtApi();
00614   virtual ~RtApi();
00615   virtual RtAudio::Api getCurrentApi( void ) = 0;
00616   virtual unsigned int getDeviceCount( void ) = 0;
00617   virtual RtAudio::DeviceInfo getDeviceInfo( unsigned int device ) = 0;
00618   virtual unsigned int getDefaultInputDevice( void );
00619   virtual unsigned int getDefaultOutputDevice( void );
00620   void openStream( RtAudio::StreamParameters *outputParameters,
00621                    RtAudio::StreamParameters *inputParameters,
00622                    RtAudioFormat format, unsigned int sampleRate,
00623                    unsigned int *bufferFrames, RtAudioCallback callback,
00624                    void *userData, RtAudio::StreamOptions *options,
00625                    RtAudioErrorCallback errorCallback );
00626   virtual void closeStream( void );
00627   virtual void startStream( void ) = 0;
00628   virtual void stopStream( void ) = 0;
00629   virtual void abortStream( void ) = 0;
00630   long getStreamLatency( void );
00631   unsigned int getStreamSampleRate( void );
00632   virtual double getStreamTime( void );
00633   bool isStreamOpen( void ) const { return stream_.state != STREAM_CLOSED; }
00634   bool isStreamRunning( void ) const { return stream_.state == STREAM_RUNNING; }
00635   void showWarnings( bool value ) { showWarnings_ = value; }
00636 
00637 
00638 protected:
00639 
00640   static const unsigned int MAX_SAMPLE_RATES;
00641   static const unsigned int SAMPLE_RATES[];
00642 
00643   enum { FAILURE, SUCCESS };
00644 
00645   enum StreamState {
00646     STREAM_STOPPED,
00647     STREAM_STOPPING,
00648     STREAM_RUNNING,
00649     STREAM_CLOSED = -50
00650   };
00651 
00652   enum StreamMode {
00653     OUTPUT,
00654     INPUT,
00655     DUPLEX,
00656     UNINITIALIZED = -75
00657   };
00658 
00659   // A protected structure used for buffer conversion.
00660   struct ConvertInfo {
00661     int channels;
00662     int inJump, outJump;
00663     RtAudioFormat inFormat, outFormat;
00664     std::vector<int> inOffset;
00665     std::vector<int> outOffset;
00666   };
00667 
00668   // A protected structure for audio streams.
00669   struct RtApiStream {
00670     unsigned int device[2];    // Playback and record, respectively.
00671     void *apiHandle;           // void pointer for API specific stream handle information
00672     StreamMode mode;           // OUTPUT, INPUT, or DUPLEX.
00673     StreamState state;         // STOPPED, RUNNING, or CLOSED
00674     char *userBuffer[2];       // Playback and record, respectively.
00675     char *deviceBuffer;
00676     bool doConvertBuffer[2];   // Playback and record, respectively.
00677     bool userInterleaved;
00678     bool deviceInterleaved[2]; // Playback and record, respectively.
00679     bool doByteSwap[2];        // Playback and record, respectively.
00680     unsigned int sampleRate;
00681     unsigned int bufferSize;
00682     unsigned int nBuffers;
00683     unsigned int nUserChannels[2];    // Playback and record, respectively.
00684     unsigned int nDeviceChannels[2];  // Playback and record channels, respectively.
00685     unsigned int channelOffset[2];    // Playback and record, respectively.
00686     unsigned long latency[2];         // Playback and record, respectively.
00687     RtAudioFormat userFormat;
00688     RtAudioFormat deviceFormat[2];    // Playback and record, respectively.
00689     StreamMutex mutex;
00690     CallbackInfo callbackInfo;
00691     ConvertInfo convertInfo[2];
00692     double streamTime;         // Number of elapsed seconds since the stream started.
00693 
00694 #if defined(HAVE_GETTIMEOFDAY)
00695     struct timeval lastTickTimestamp;
00696 #endif
00697 
00698     RtApiStream()
00699       :apiHandle(0), deviceBuffer(0) { device[0] = 11111; device[1] = 11111; }
00700   };

00762 inline RtAudio::Api RtAudio :: getCurrentApi( void ) throw() { return rtapi_->getCurrentApi(); }
00763 inline unsigned int RtAudio :: getDeviceCount( void ) throw() { return rtapi_->getDeviceCount(); }
00764 inline RtAudio::DeviceInfo RtAudio :: getDeviceInfo( unsigned int device ) { return rtapi_->getDeviceInfo( device ); }
00765 inline unsigned int RtAudio :: getDefaultInputDevice( void ) throw() { return rtapi_->getDefaultInputDevice(); }
00766 inline unsigned int RtAudio :: getDefaultOutputDevice( void ) throw() { return rtapi_->getDefaultOutputDevice(); }
00767 inline void RtAudio :: closeStream( void ) throw() { return rtapi_->closeStream(); }
00768 inline void RtAudio :: startStream( void ) { return rtapi_->startStream(); }
00769 inline void RtAudio :: stopStream( void )  { return rtapi_->stopStream(); }
00770 inline void RtAudio :: abortStream( void ) { return rtapi_->abortStream(); }
00771 inline bool RtAudio :: isStreamOpen( void ) const throw() { return rtapi_->isStreamOpen(); }
00772 inline bool RtAudio :: isStreamRunning( void ) const throw() { return rtapi_->isStreamRunning(); }
00773 inline long RtAudio :: getStreamLatency( void ) { return rtapi_->getStreamLatency(); }
00774 inline unsigned int RtAudio :: getStreamSampleRate( void ) { return rtapi_->getStreamSampleRate(); }
00775 inline double RtAudio :: getStreamTime( void ) { return rtapi_->getStreamTime(); }
00776 inline void RtAudio :: showWarnings( bool value ) throw() { rtapi_->showWarnings( value ); }

00798   void abortStream( void );
00799   long getStreamLatency( void );
00800 
00801   // This function is intended for internal use only.  It must be
00802   // public because it is called by the internal callback handler,
00803   // which is not a member of RtAudio.  External use of this function
00804   // will most likely produce highly undesireable results!
00805   bool callbackEvent( AudioDeviceID deviceId,
00806                       const AudioBufferList *inBufferList,
00807                       const AudioBufferList *outBufferList );
00808 
00809   private:
00810 
00811   bool probeDeviceOpen( unsigned int device, StreamMode mode, unsigned int channels, 
00812                         unsigned int firstChannel, unsigned int sampleRate,
00813                         RtAudioFormat format, unsigned int *bufferSize,
00814                         RtAudio::StreamOptions *options );
00815   static const char* getErrorCode( OSStatus code );
00816 };

01028 class RtApiDummy: public RtApi
01029 {
01030 public:
01031 
01032   RtApiDummy() { errorText_ = "RtApiDummy: This class provides no functionality."; error( RtError::WARNING ); }
01033   RtAudio::Api getCurrentApi( void ) { return RtAudio::RTAUDIO_DUMMY; }
01034   unsigned int getDeviceCount( void ) { return 0; }
01035   RtAudio::DeviceInfo getDeviceInfo( unsigned int /*device*/ ) { RtAudio::DeviceInfo info; return info; }
01036   void closeStream( void ) {}
01037   void startStream( void ) {}
01038   void stopStream( void ) {}
01039   void abortStream( void ) {}
01040 
01041   private:
01042 
01043   bool probeDeviceOpen( unsigned int /*device*/, StreamMode /*mode*/, unsigned int /*channels*/, 
01044                         unsigned int /*firstChannel*/, unsigned int /*sampleRate*/,
01045                         RtAudioFormat /*format*/, unsigned int * /*bufferSize*/,
01046                         RtAudio::StreamOptions * /*options*/ ) { return false; }
01047 };
01048 
01049 #endif
01050 
01051 #endif
